_header: Thou shalt haven no God buten one

OxfUni96.Transcription:
Þu shalt haue no god but oonYdel wothes swere þu
                    nonThe halyday þu shalt gemeffader and moder þu shalt
                    quemeloke þu sle no mando þu foly with no womanBe no
                    þef ne þeves fereffals wyttenes bere þu neuereCouete
                    þu no mannes housNor no þyng þat his ys ne his
                    spouseffor þese ben þe hestes tenÞat god comandeþ
                    to all men
OxfUni96.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932: 219-20.

CULFf615.First Lines:
þu salt hauen na god buten anIaeladh ne swere þu
                    Nan…
CULFf615.Last Lines:
…Yierne þu nout þin nethtebure husNoth þat his
                    is ne his spus
CULFf615.Note:
Side-by-side English and Latin verse versions of the Ten
                    Commandments.
CULFf615.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             An Old English Miscellany: A Bestiary, Kentish Sermons, Proverbs of
                Alfred and Religious Poems of the Thirteenth Century.
EETS
         o.s. 49 (1872); repr. 1988: 200.
Luard,  Henry,  and  Charles Hardwick, eds.  
             A Catalogue of the Manuscripts Preserved in the Library of the
                University of Cambridge.
         5 vols. Cambridge: at the UP, 1856-67: 2.522.
Reichl,  Karl,
                        ed.  
             Religiöse Dichtung im Englischen Hochmittelalter: Untersuchen und
                Edition der Handschrift B. 14.39 des Trinity College in Cambridge.
Münchener Universitäts Schriften, Text und Untersuchungen zur
                Englische Philologie 1
         Munich: Wilhelm Fink, 1973: 334.
